What size do you want for /dev/sda5 ?
I want to use those unallocated 30gb..
You want to use the unallocated Partition before /dev/sda2 , right ?
That is not easily possible because /dev/sda2 is an extended partition and will AFAIK not move whern there are other partitions inside it.
is there data in the ext4 FS  that needs to be retained ?
Otherwise, you could just kill all partitions and re-setup them fresh and clean
yes .. it seems I have to reinstall everything again just because I had windows installed .. really lame
Well, not necessarily
You have data (an installed os) in the ext4 fs, right ?
i dont know man it's data (documents, music etc
There is of course the option to shift the whole filesystem by hand. But the procedure is rather dangerous. Would it suffice for you if you could mount the remaining 30gb e.g. like /extra30gb ?
no I dont want that
Even if you use gparted, wouldf you have a backup of the stuff ? Using gparted can lead to catastrophic failures if something unexpected happens
You don't want waht ? Shifting by hand or mounting the extra space ?
I dont a separate partition for the 30gb tks for the help anyway

you could try duplicating the existing filesystem to the unoccupied partition if it fits there. then you use that and later, you kill /dev/sda5, then you expand the now existing partition (dev/sda1 to fill the wohle drive
Of course you have to be lucky,  i.e. /dev/sda5 has to "fit" in the first partition
